name: sfchronicle
text:
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs pretty devastating and heartbreaking. Reopening really depends on a case-by-case basis now. Some businesses were completely destroyed and they‚Äôll take longer to recover.‚Äù

name: sfchronicle
text: Traffic has resumed on Interstate 680 in Walnut Creek after police officers used tear gas, rubber bullets and flash bangs to clear protesters who blocked lanes in both directions. https://t.co/V875EN44dq

name: sfchronicle
text: Lafayette‚Äôs curfew, which applies to its downtown area, is now 8 p.m., not 9 p.m., according to the city. https://t.co/Cd9K5rwxAt

name: sfchronicle
text:
A truck ‚Äî displaying the names of Bay Area people killed by police ‚Äî drives alongside demonstrators in Oakland protesting police brutality and the police killing of George Floyd.

name: sfchronicle
text:
Demonstrators engage officers in Oakland while protesting police brutality and the police killing of George Floyd.

This young woman asks police why there‚Äôs a curfew, when 1,000 people peacefully protested today, reports @MalloryMoench.

Live updates: https://t.co/yo4wAY4SI0 https://t.co/p0vkVwX11V

name: sfchronicle
text: An online petition circulating among infectious disease and public health professionals is calling on law enforcement to stop using tear gas. https://t.co/nfLlQJb4xb

name: sfchronicle
text: According to a UCSF spokesperson, the petition says tear gas "could make the respiratory tract more susceptible to‚Ä¶ https://t.co/96S47qLivQ

name: sfchronicle
text: The SF public defender is calling for an overhaul on use-of-force policies at the SFPD, after a bystander video surfaced last week that appeared to show an officer pressing her knee on a black teenager‚Äôs neck. https://t.co/wI8kChd1wm

text: The petition also calls on officials to wear masks, maintain social distancing, and set up hand-washing stations to‚Ä¶ https://t.co/vsWx0YnmYe

name: sfchronicle
text:

name: sfchronicle
text: Here are the curfews ‚Äî plus major service and business closures. https://t.co/DhiJkbQjGb

name: sfchronicle
text: A line of police started firing tear gas to disperse the crowd on Broadway and 8th in Oakland 10 minutes before the curfew was to begin. Dozens of people are milling about downtown. ‚ÄúIf you‚Äôre not ready to get arrested, leave now‚Äù one protester yells. https://t.co/1kRCdS2TWz

name: sfchronicle
text: Shopping, outdoor dining, childcare programs and religious services will resume in Santa Clara County under an amended shelter-in-place policy expected to go into effect Friday. https://t.co/M9D5ydcvMK

name: sfchronicle
text:
A few hundred demonstrators shut down the intersection on 14th St. and Broadway in Oakland past curfew.

Live updates: https://t.co/yo4wAY4SI0 https://t.co/IHQn10yNbV

name: sfchronicle
text:
Citing ‚Äúrecent information regarding planned looting‚Äù and an ‚Äúabundance of caution,‚Äù the city of Vallejo enacted a curfew from 8 p.m. to 5 a.m., to remain in effect ‚Äúuntil further notice.‚Äù

https://t.co/AeCdsIi84b

name: sfchronicle
text:

name: sfchronicle
text: A state appeals court reinstated a lawsuit Monday by a limo driver who accused an LA airport policeman of using excessive force ‚Äî non-lethal, in this case ‚Äî by planting his knee on the driver‚Äôs back and hitting him while he lay face-down. https://t.co/wPANqjVNEy

name: sfchronicle
text:
‚ÄúWhat I want to say to my Hollywood friends is you got to get out here,‚Äù Jamie Foxx said on the steps of City Hall. ‚ÄúYou can‚Äôt tweet. You can‚Äôt text. ... You have to understand, people are hurting.‚Äù

https://t.co/75xaVojjFr https://t.co/zgh46Olfav

name: sfchronicle
text:
A police helicopter announces the curfew order in Alameda County as a group of demonstrators make their way north on Telegraph to protest the police killing of George Floyd.

Police say violators will be subject to arrest. 

Live updates: https://t.co/yo4wAY4SI0 https://t.co/7vrQOVmCEW

name: sfchronicle
text: Oakland police estimated that 15,000 people gathered to protest peacefully in the city on Monday, according to a Tweet from the department. https://t.co/bjB8Ftxq3l

name: sfchronicle
text: Police officers detained roughly 50 people on Broadway between 14th and Telegraph Avenues in Oakland shortly after the 8 p.m. curfew went into effect. https://t.co/zkaW9JolTE

name: sfchronicle
text: Roughly 200 people continued a peaceful protest near Santa Rosa Junior College after the 8 p.m. curfew went into effect Monday night. https://t.co/wFgERo4rFP

name: sfchronicle
text: At least 100 people have been arrested in Alameda County on Monday night, according to the Sheriff‚Äôs Office. https://t.co/8xO7QjfTLm

name: sfchronicle
text: RT @mallorymoench: Looters broke into an empty Sears in Hilltop Mall in Richmond but were quickly apprehended just after 7 pm, police said. At least a dozen were arrested, others fled. Attempts were also made to break into Macy‚Äôs and Walmart at the mall and Target in downtown Richmond. https://t.co/0iZsETiysFLooters broke into an empty Sears in Hilltop Mall in Richmond but were quickly apprehended just after 7 pm, police‚Ä¶ https://t.co/nrQJrskzEA

name: sfchronicle
text: It may be at least a decade before the U.S. economy fully bounces back from the coronavirus pandemic‚Äôs economic devastation, the Congressional Budget Office projected Monday. https://t.co/bvytl3NM3H https://t.co/eoY1ecCe1c

name: sfchronicle
text: False reports of looting and rioting spread in parts of the Bay Area Tuesday, including in the East Bay communities of Richmond and Albany and in San Mateo County. According to NBC News, similar reports, posted online, have spread across the nation. https://t.co/BOHVvZhUbc https://t.co/swgOjNzaBo

name: sfchronicle
text: Oakland police arrested 100 people in connection with Monday night‚Äôs demonstration, officials said in an email news release sent at 3:25 a.m. Eighty were taken into custody for curfew violations.  https://t.co/afzAGwSDuX https://t.co/Q5GBRgI3Oe

text: A protest march, billed as peaceful and positive, is scheduled for this afternoon in Fairfield, a day after looting took place at the Solano Mall.  https://t.co/OOdDg3L1WV https://t.co/UPhfk5BLQM

name: sfchronicle
text:
Here's what happened around the Bay Area last night and early this morning:
‚ñ™Ô∏èOakland entered a strategic stance of ‚Äúzero tolerance‚Äù for violence and destruction. Police arrested 100 people overnight.

name: sfchronicle

China sat on releasing the genetic map, or genome, of the coronavirus for more than a week, which frustrated World Health Organization officials who needed information to fight the spread of the deadly virus, the Associated Press has found.
